Package com.example.networkmeup.dao

Interface EmployeeDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
EmployeeDAOMemory
public interface EmployeeDAO
EmployeeDAO interface outlines the methods that should be implemented by classes responsible for handling Employee data access operations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    authenticate(Email email, Password password)
    Authenticates an employee based on provided email and password.
    void
    delete(Employee employee)
    Deletes the specified employee from the data source.
    boolean
    find(Employee employee)
    Checks if the specified employee exists in the data source.
    ArrayList<Employee>
    getAll()
    Retrieves a list of all employees from the data source.
    Employee

    Retrieves an Employee object based on the provided email address.
    void
    save(Employee employee)
    Saves or updates the information of an employee in the data source.

  • Method Details

    • delete

      void delete(Employee employee)
      Deletes the specified employee from the data source.
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object to be deleted.

    • getAll

      ArrayList<Employee> getAll()
      Retrieves a list of all employees from the data source.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing all the Employee objects.

    • save

      void save(Employee employee)
      Saves or updates the information of an employee in the data source.
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object to be saved or updated.

    • find

      boolean find(Employee employee)
      Checks if the specified employee exists in the data source.
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object to check for existence.
      Returns:
      True if the Employee exists, otherwise False.

    • getByEmail

      Employee getByEmail(Email email)
      Retrieves an Employee object based on the provided email address.
      Parameters:
      email - The Email object representing the email address of the employee.
      Returns:
      The Employee object associated with the provided email, if found; otherwise null.

    • authenticate

      boolean authenticate(Email email, Password password)
      Authenticates an employee based on provided email and password.
      Parameters:
      email - The email input for authentication. It represents the email of the employee attempting to log in.
      password - The password input for authentication. It represents the password of the employee attempting to log in.
      Returns:
      true if the provided email and password match an employee's credentials, indicating successful authentication. Otherwise, returns false if no match is found, signifying failed authentication.
